TopicTitle: [1.12.X] Tantares - Stockalike Soyuz and MIR [16.1][28.05.2024][{Proton Revamp]

Articles.Content:
3 hours ago, Daylight4449 said:

i love this mod so much! but i cant seem to switch the textures of the parts, how do i?

you must manually replace the textures if you wish them to switch. Texture switch is a planned feature (as I recall) but only once it comes out in stock which is dues to happen with Making History?
thank you! and one more question, is this mod tweakscale compatable?

26 minutes ago, Daylight4449 said:

thank you! and one more question, is this mod tweakscale compatable?

No

18 hours ago, Beale said:

Thankyouthankyouthankyouthankyou!

Also, the new Service Module in your post a few down from this one is by FAR the best iteration of the Tantares SM yet. I give you the highest of fives for this!

6 hours ago, Daylight4449 said:

thank you! and one more question, is this mod tweakscale compatible?

used to be, but many part names changed, is very easy to make new configs, let me know if you need help.

20 hours ago, Chimer4 said:

I just imagine a cork popping sound when the kerbal comes out of that hatch 

Also what fuel tank is that? I thought it was an Oscar b at first

It is the Oscar-B  
Kind of like a "Ven's stock revamp".

 

GitHub

"No warranty" edition, seriously a lot is half-finished, but if you want to try the new parts, and don't mind some missing textures, this will suit you well!
No risk of losing craft, etc.

Baele must be stopped.

GitHub

 Smaller docking ports added.
 Parachute added.

@Beale My wife just asked why I was jumping, how can I tell my lady that I'm happy because the heat shield on the Soyuz is the only part that gets hot on reentry?

Edit: no no, nobody can stop the beale

17 hours ago, Drakenex said:

Ay! That's super nice!

2 hours ago, curtquarquesso said:

I attempted to hand over the Wings model to Beale, but was unable to locate it unfortunately. It's not a very difficult shape to model at all. He's already done the little yellow IGLA antenna, and made a docking light, so it's sensible that he finish up the Soyuz parts with a cupola. @Beale, what think you?

To be honest, I planned to create it as an entirely new Orbital module - you get two benefits:

1. Integrate with the mesh correctly (This is hard with a separate cylinder shape, and you get clipping through the middle of edges.
2. In an IVA that could be made, you can actually use the view window.

 

 

Hey I have some new stuff!

So, two options here:

1. The backup engine is changed to a full-fledged engine module (Throttle controlled, etc) and you can switch between LOX mode and Monopropellant mode.
2. Two module RCS, one for the backup engine and another module for the attitude control. The only downside here is there are two "enable RCS" buttons.

Cannot use one ModuleRCS for forward thrust and yaw/pitch because KSP does some silly things, Ex. uses the rear mono thrusters for yaw and pitch control adding unwarnted forward motion.

Does that make any sense?

Edited November 7, 2017 by Beale

Hey I have some new stuff!

So, two options here:

1. The backup engine is changed to a full-fledged engine module (Throttle controlled, etc) and you can switch between LOX mode and Monopropellant mode.
2. Two module RCS, one for the backup engine and another module for the attitude control. The only downside here is there are two "enable RCS" buttons.

Cannot use one ModuleRCS for forward thrust and yaw/pitch because KSP does some silly things, Ex. uses the rear mono thrusters for yaw and pitch control adding unwarnted forward motion.

Does that make any sense?

Spoiler

I did't reply in this one 

Personally, I would have it as two RCS modules. You can always put it on to fore by throttle anyway for the backup engine. But I see the appeal of either option

Ay! That's super nice!

To be honest, I planned to create it as an entirely new Orbital module - you get two benefits:

1. Integrate with the mesh correctly (This is hard with a separate cylinder shape, and you get clipping through the middle of edges.
2. In an IVA that could be made, you can actually use the view window.

Hey I have some new stuff!

 

So, two options here:

1. The backup engine is changed to a full-fledged engine module (Throttle controlled, etc) and you can switch between LOX mode and Monopropellant mode.
2. Two module RCS, one for the backup engine and another module for the attitude control. The only downside here is there are two "enable RCS" buttons.

Cannot use one ModuleRCS for forward thrust and yaw/pitch because KSP does some silly things, Ex. uses the rear mono thrusters for yaw and pitch control adding unwarnted forward motion.

Does that make any sense?

Great! yes, a third orbital module is the way to go.

8 hours ago, Beale said:

Skirt FX!

GitHub

WOO HOO!!!

Sorry! damn temp hosting

I know @Beale wants to wait for stock texture switching, but because the DLC who will enable it doesn't have a release date (AFAIK), well, I made a patch, if the man is OK I will share it

2 hours ago, Drakenex said:

Sorry! damn temp hosting

I know @Beale wants to wait for stock texture switching, but because the DLC who will enable it doesn't have a release date (AFAIK), well, I made a patch, if the man is OK I will share it

Very happy of course.
My only comment is: For the black parts, you want to adjust the layers called "body higher" to around 40-50% opacity, otherwise the highlights along the panel edges look a little too strong. For "black" parts I am planning with my own textures to go with a base colour of #595959 or darker grey, but a range of shades works well.

Re: the Shenzhou! Wow! Nice job.  Could we see the Drakenex chinese pack in future I wonder?  
All that is really needed is the OM solar panels (But, did later Shenzhou flights remove those anyway?).

Edited November 8, 2017 by Beale

28 minutes ago, Beale said:

Very happy of course.
My only comment is: For the black parts, you want to adjust the layers called "body higher" to around 40-50% opacity, otherwise the highlights along the panel edges look a little too strong. For "black" parts I am planning with my own textures to go with a base colour of #595959 or darker grey, but a range of shades works well.

Re: the Shenzhou! Wow! Nice job.  Could we see the Drakenex chinese pack in future I wonder?  
All that is really needed is the OM solar panels (But, did later Shenzhou flights remove those anyway?).

Great advice thanks!

The only Chinese packs are the ones with stuff from dealxtreme arriving in the mail , but seriously, yes, I can try to make an special parts re-texture to make Tiangong-1/2. And yes, they removes the panels from the OM.

 

And about the texture switch stuff, I'll complete the patch including CM, OM, engine, decoupler, heatshield and parachute. Let me know how do you want to include it, may be a GH fork?, that way you can include alt textures and other submitted ones.

And talking about submitted work, Beale made alternate textures work childs play this time, so there's no excuse to request anything, go make it, then share it!

Time to raise your dongers for 1975
This engine will run totally on Monopropellant.


Edited November 8, 2017 by Beale

On 28.5.2017 at 11:21 AM, Fly Angry said:

Firespitter texture switches done for all Soyuz parts. These parts are also repaintable on EVA, in case your Kerbonauts deviate from the program and decide to show their artistic spacewalking skills.

I dialled back the saturation of the colours I was using. I think they blend much more nicely with the default Tantares scheme now, but I'm open to suggestions and criticism.

 

@DrakenexGreat to hear you add a Textureswitching. Do you add only the grey and the black ones? Or do  you add more ones? It would be cool to have some textures like @Fly Angry showed in the pic (dark green and light blue).
